cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi (210 km) south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the northwestern Caribbean today, cross western Cuba Tuesday, enter the central Gulf Wednesday and accelerate toward the Louisiana coast late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central or southwest Louisiana coast (near the Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana into coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely Friday; potential for hurricane-force gusts if Delta strengthens further before landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Initial guidance suggests 3–6 ft of surge possible along the southwest Louisiana coastline including Calcasieu Pass and Lake Charles ship channel
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk in the Lake Charles area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands, very rough seas and dangerous marine conditions throughout Calcasieu Lake and approaches
